children.value: Pull Request decoration is available as part of
You can add SonarQube analysis and a Quality Gate to your Pull Requests (PR) in your ALM provider's interface.
Click your ALM provider below to expand the instructions on decorating your Pull Requests.
For GitHub Enterprise, the minimum version is 2.14
To add Pull Request decoration in GitHub checks, an instance administrator needs to create a GitHub App:
to start creating your GitHub App.

. This will take you to your new GitHub App's page.
Scroll down to the bottom of your app page and click

Install your GitHub App from the app's settings page. See the
To set your global settings in SonarQube, navigate to
Administration > Configuration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
Make sure the Configuration name is succinct and easily recognizable as it will be used at the project level to identify the correct ALM configuration.
Administration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
A Bitbucket Server user account is used to decorate Pull Requests. We recommend creating a dedicated Bitbucket Server account with Administrator permissions to decorate Pull Requests. You need a
permission for the repositories that will be analyzed.
To add Pull Request decoration on Bitbucket Server, you also need to update your global and project settings.
To set your global settings in SonarQube, navigate to
Administration > Configuration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
of the account you're using to decorate your Pull Requests.
Make sure the Configuration name is succinct and easily recognizable as it will be used at the project level to identify the correct ALM configuration.
Administration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration

from this account with the scope authorized for
for the repositories that will be analyzed.
To add Pull Request decoration on Azure DevOps Server, you also need to update your global and project settings.
To set your global settings in SonarQube, navigate to
Administration > Configuration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
of the account you're using to decorate your Pull Requests.
Make sure the Configuration name is succinct and easily recognizable as it will be used at the project level to identify the correct ALM configuration.
Administration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
For GitLab Self-Managed, the minimum version is 11.7
A GitLab user account is used to decorate Merge Requests. We recommend creating a dedicated GitLab account with at least
(the account needs permission to leave comments) to decorate Merge Requests. You need a Personal Access Token from this account with the scope authorized for
for the repositories that will be analyzed.
To add Merge Request decoration to GitLab, you also need to update your global and project settings.
To set your global settings in SonarQube, navigate to
Administration > Configuration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration
of the account you're using to decorate your Merge Requests.
Make sure the Configuration name is succinct and easily recognizable as it will be used at the project level to identify the correct ALM configuration.
Administration > General Settings > Pull Request Decoration

It's possible to decorate Pull Requests from multiple ALM instances. To do this, you can create a configuration (as shown in the previous section) for each of your ALM instances. That instance configuration can then be assigned to the appropriate projects.
, you can create one configuration for each ALM.
, you can create multiple configurations for each ALM.
During pull request decoration, individual issues will be linked to their SonarQube counterparts automatically. However, for this to work correctly, the instance's
Administration > Configuration > General Settings > General > General
) must be set correctly. Otherwise the links will default to
